lines.text: We got trouble on our hands, Shelby.
Some of the cattle on my ranch are showing infection - hoof-and-mouth disease.
If that infection ever hits the stockyards, it will spread all over the country.
By that time we'll have our money out of 'em. Let somebody else worry about it.
[Frog tries to keep a bunch of cattlemen from breaking through his checkpoint]
I'm warnin' you. If you take any cattle across this line, I'm going to blast you with this smokestick - and it ain't loaded with beans!
What were you going to say?
I wasn't going to say anything.
He was going to sing you that song about moonlight on the ranchhouse.
[Frog tries to attract an elephant's attention]
I got a peanut for you!
It's no use. She's hard of hearing.
Ears like a barn door and she's hard of hearing?
